name: Blob of Annihilation
lore: A blob of annihilation is a terrible ooze suffused with the destructive energy of the Negative Plane. These amorphous horrors dissolve all nonmagical matter they touch, leaving nothing behind. A blob might form spontaneously in places where the fabric of the multiverse is worn thin or in the wake of powerful necromantic magic.
damageImmunities: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.description: The blob can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

traits.name: Annihilation
traits.description: The blob destroys any nonmagical object or creation of magical force that touches it. A creature that touches the blob or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 22 (4d10) Force damage. A creature can take this damage no more than once per turn.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The blob can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach 10 ft. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 22 (4d10) Force damage. If the target is a nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried, it is destroyed.

hit.additionalEffects: If the target is a nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried, it is destroyed.
